Job_Description: Work between our engineering organization and stakeholders from our data science, growth, sales, marketing, and product teams, to understand the data needs of the business and produce pipelines, data marts and other data solutions that enable better product and growth decision-making. Design and update our foundational business tables in order to simplify analysis across the entire company. Continue to improve the performance and reliability of our data-warehouse. Build and enforce a pattern language across our data stack, ensuring that our event taxonomy and tables are consistent, accurate, and well-understood. Who you are Youre passionate and thoughtful about building systems that enhance human understanding. You have professional experience designing, creating and maintaining scalable data pipelines. Youve wrangled enough data to understand how often the complex systems that produce data can go wrong. You can write clear, correct code in at least one programming language, and are willing to become effective in others as needed to get your job done. You are highly effective with SQL and understand how to write and tune complex queries. You communicate with clarity and precision in written form; experience communicating with graphs and plots, or at least understanding how to enable other people to do this, is a big bonus.
Title: Data Engineer at Airtable

Job_Description: At Emory Healthcare, we integrate science and caring to change the face of health care. Our team members are courageous individuals who are willing to challenge the status quo and help find solutions to complex problems. We’re empowered to influence change for, and with, our patients, their families, the community and each other. As one of the leading academic medical systems, we’re eager to share what we learn with hospitals around the country, and the world. We’ve got the backing, knowledge, experience and permission to lead the way in developing new and better approaches to preventing and treating disease, and our patients get treatments years before anyone else. We’re defining a new standard of care for humankind. Are YOU ready to join us Description JOB SUMMARY The Associate Chief Nursing Officer (ACNO) is responsible for overseeing day to day clinical operations and patient flow for Emory Healthcare (EHC) hospitals or Physician Group Practice sites. The ACNO is accountable for successful implementation of initiatives in support of the nursing annual operating plan and core nursing care delivery systems. This oversight includes successful achievement of clinical quality oCompanyomes and patient/family experiences. The ACNO is responsible for deploying entity goals, adequate and appropriate staffing resources, managing budgetary expectations, maintaining regulatory readiness and mentoring and coaching direct reports. Reporting to the entity CNO, the ACNO serves as a member of the senior leadership team for nursing. Serves in the absence of the CNO. Specific expectations are as follows Strategic Planning Participate in the development and implementation of the nursing strategic plan aligned with the overall EHC nursing strategic plan. Implement nursing related elements of the entity specific annual operating plan. Determine avenues to improve the value (qualitative and quantitative) of care and services. Leadership Provide vision, direction, and leadership to departments within Nursing in concert with Chief Nursing Officer. Leads program planning, implementation, and evaluation efforts for areas of responsibility both at strategic and tactical level. Maintain personal development plan and provide management development and coaching for other members of the team. Represent EHC at state, local and national level through involvement in professional associations and organizations. Participate in community service. Human Resources Management Assure adequate quality and number of staff by assuring adherence to department productivity measures. Maintain a focus on internal talent management and retention. Meet or exceed yearly goals for vacancy and turnover rate.Complete evaluations within the allotted timeframe. Assure that staff and unit directors/practice leaders are actively engaged in unit and organizational professional governance activities as reflected in the minutes and other related documents. Financial Management Assure financial accountability for annual operating and capital expenditures and budgets. Meet yearly goals for contribution margin, percent variance from budget and overtime rate. Assure efficiencies in staffing and resource utilization by comparison with internal and external benchmarks as measured by productivity units appropriate for areas managed. Performance Improvement/Safety Continually assess and improve the performance of care and services provided. Assures continual readiness for regulatory compliance. Maintains an environment that promotes a safety culture. Supports performance improvement activities. Meets annual quality and safety goals as defined by the EHC balance scorecard. Ensures a high level of customer service, including patient and family centered initiatives. Facilitates the development and implementation of evidence-based practice and quality efforts. Drives research in associated area of responsibility. Technology Oversees appropriate use of technology in the delivery of nursing care through optimization of available tools and platforms. Integrates nursing, its information, knowledge, and management with information and communication technologies to promote care delivery. Seeks innovative ways to leverage technology, data science and predictive Organizationeling in the development of care delivery and process improvement efforts. Regulatory Compliance Sustains a working understanding of regulatory requirements and accreditation standards. Evaluate area of responsibility for compliance with regulatory and accreditation standards. Identify best practices as well as deficiencies to share with peers and make recommendations for improvement. Participate in the development of corrective action plans to guide needed and sustainable improvements. Work with nursing department leaders, Quality Management and accreditation specialist to improve staff competency, compliance and documentation. Enhance relationships to promote interdisciplinary involvement and knowledge of compliance standards, status, and actions. Track laws, regulations and standards that may affect practice and policies. Work with direct reports to insure that needed changes are made by the effective date of any change(s) in requirements. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Masters degree required. Doctorate in nursing preferred. If Masters degree is other than nursing, must have a BSN. 10 years of progressive nursing experience with a minimum of five years of progressive administrative experience required. Current licensure as a registered nurse in the state of Georgia or able to obtain a Georgia license. Certification in nursing administration and/or area of expertise required. Strong work ethic with demonstrated competency in nursing practice including care delivery Organizationels, care coordination and labor management. Demonstrated expertise in self-directed problem analysis and project management. Expertise in evidence based practice, budget development, budget management, regulatory readiness, and innovative solution development. Excellent public speaking skills with stellar verbal/written communication skills. High level critical thinking, negotiation, and decision making skills are essential. Must be able to comprehend and interpret policies, procedures, and standards of practice. Is able to meet the expectations of multiple constituencies with service-oriented philosophy. Must be effective in matrix management.
Title: Associate Chief Nursing Officer at Emory Healthcare

Job_Description: Understand the business landscape and identify right product-market fit Research market size, market growth, market segments and model the revenue opportunity based on this analysis. Engage with existing customers and new prospects to understand product and feature requirements Analyze the competitive landscape and provide competitive overview, strength / weaknesses analysis of key competitors. Work closely with Data Science team on ‘data swimming’ projects to find insights that can be packaged and delivered as product features Assist in making the business case for appropriate investment levels based on market demand, sales results and Envestnet | Yodlee’s strategic goals for the Investment and Market Research segments. Deliver a Product Requirement Document (PRD) from this analysis as user stories and epics. PRD should include product and feature specifics that the delivery team will execute on Contribute to the entire product life cycle from concept through planning to development and sales supporting activities for the existing and new products Create content for product collateral such as product description document, solution presentations, datasheets, whitepapers, FAQs, press releases Deliver a product road map for both internal and external consumption based on business and customer feedback to validate the feature releases. DELIVERY Deliver a PRD with a prioritized list of features for Engineering, Data Science, Quality Assurance and Operations teams to scope and execute on Aggressively track product and feature delivery to meet expected time-to-market goals Manage all aspects of in-life products, including customer feedback, issue tracking and resolution in subsequent releases Provide Product Marketing with insights on key differentiators and messages Collaborate with tech publications to deliver high quality technical documentation. Develop a product launch kit for new product offerings Develop core positioning and messaging for the product Help in sales trainings at quarterly sales meeting Qualifications Prior experience working with large data sets. Data warehousing, ETL and business intelligence background preferred. 2+ Years of Product Management experience Demonstrated interest and knowledge in data mining, analysis and relational database concepts Ability to execute – take action and bring projects to a timely closure Experience with launching new products, from ground up preferred Strong organization, planning & analysis skills Technical Background with an MBA preferred Ability to work independently and excel in a fast paced work environment Experience working with off-shore development teams. There will be some portion of time spent with offshore engineering and analytics team so ability to work with flexible hours required Ability to demonstrate “clarity of thought” at all times and within all types of communications Excellent presentation skills Ability to forge a strong & credible working relationship with Engineering, Data Science, Quality Assurance, Sales and Marketing teams Successful candidates will offer strategic perspective, sound business judgment, deep analytical skills and highly collaborative working style Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States at the time of application and not require employment visa sponsorship in the future
Title: Product Manager at Yodlee

Job_Description: Company is an ecommerce company that connects brands with customers wherever they love to shop online. We delight our customers every day by putting our technology, marketing, and supply chain to work for them behind the scenes. Born and raised in Lincoln, Nebraska, Company has grown into offices and fulfillment centers in 8 cities across 6 states. The Supply Chain department consists of Operations, Transportation, Inventory, Fulfillment and Reverse logistics. Supply Chain is focused on providing the best experience regardless of where goods are manufactured or shipped from. The goal is to delight our customer’s needs by providing next day delivery across the country. The Company Supply Chain team is seeking a Head of Demand planning to develop, manage, and maintain a comprehensive Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning (SIOP) process which can be used across our organization. The Supply Chain Team manages a large portfolio of internal and contract manufactured product and is responsible for supporting a wide variety of initiatives that cross business teams and operations groups within Company. This role will work closely with our leadership team and stakeholders to develop performance metrics, drive best practices, and lead process and tool improvements that are in alignment with the strategic priorities of the team.  This role is a critical component of our organization and creates our demand plan that determines how and where we place inventory to deliver our customer experience, manage our inventory capital, and optimize our overall supply chain. As the Head of Demand Planning, you will: Report directly to the Head of Supply Chain, leading a team of eight from our office in Lincoln, Nebraska. Lead an integrated monthly SOP process between the Inventory Planning team and important partners to help translate demand from multiple operational groups within Company into an manageable SIOP plan. Work with teams to understand demand forecast drivers, including the implementation of new processes, models, and technology. Assemble and analyze all data relevant to creating the demand plan. Provide input to develop demand planning strategies on existing products, new products, and product phase-outs. Analyze the impacts of changes to the demand plan with Supply Chain team partners, including Logistics, Vendor Management, and Purchasing. Support monthly inventory forecasting and reporting. Report performance metrics, ensuring master data is accurate and maintained on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis. Evolve and maintain standard operating procedures for demand planning systems, providing recommendations for operational improvements. Who you are: You have a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Retail Planning, or Information Systems Management. 8+ years of experience in Supply Chain, Planning, or Inventory Management or equivalent experience such as Consulting, Finance, or Operations. You have demonstrated the ability to dive in and quickly understand issues and identify scalable solutions. You have advanced Excel skills (can maintain complex spreadsheets) and are familiar with the principles of statistical inventory control. You have experience in high growth and high sku demand planning within a company. You have modeled and lead technical teams in a data science space.
Title: Head of Demand at Spreetail

Job_Description: As a Software Architect, you'll be working with software engineering team and also across the enterprise in developing creative, breakthrough services.   You'll be part of an energetic and engaged team that is working on the latest generation technology to build B2B eCommerce platform, business process improvement solutions, data science projects that help predict future trends and much more.  You'll bring your hands-on technical expertise in collaborating with others to establish a technical vision and then see it through to reality.   You will also mentor and coach the engineering team as well as help instill industry best practices. Platform is leading-edge .Net Core, Azure, C# .Net, Angular, REST API's, Microservices architecture. The successful candidate will have a track record as as a Solutions Architect in an enterprise level .Net environment, built upon a solid professional foundation in software engineering. Highly collaborative, team orientation, excellent interpersonal skills and team orientation are personal qualities that will help insure success.
Title: Software Architect at Newcastle Associates, Inc.

Job_Description: As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and help shape the future of how data is used in the Enterprise.  Use AWS Cloud Platform to build Enterprise-grade Big Data solutions. Architect and build new cloud-based data pipelines. Bring together multiple data sources into a unified data warehouse. Apply analytics and visualizations to customer data sets. Help customers understand the right technologies for their use case. Establish strategic customer relationships and become their go-to trusted advisor for Big Data needs. Assist in strategic direction and planning for growth of the Cloud Data Team. Required Skills and Experience:  Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Data Science or a related discipline. 5+ years or more of enterprise-level consulting. Experience with large data sets and Enterprise-grade databases (structured and unstructured) Experience architecting and building data pipelines. Deep understanding of the ETL (extract, transform, load) process. Experience extracting data from multiple sources via APIs and scripting. Experience transforming data through field mapping, programmatic rulesets, and data integrity checking. Able to expertly convey ideas and concepts to others. Excellent communication skills (verbal, written and presentation) Preferred:  AWS Big Data Specialty Certification
Title: Data Architect at True North Consultants, Inc.

Job_Description: Job Description Drive strategic development of execution of technical strategies to build a cohesive aggregation of data for analytical purposes. Efforts will support the strategic objectives of a business segment, including providing continuous strategic oversight, identifying and executing ongoing improvements, and driving organizational change in how we leverage data to drive the business forward. Partner closely with various cross-functional audiences, including business leaders, analytic teams, technology partners, and other data management/governance leaders to support a more data-centric organization. May get involved with leading business analytic and BI reporting teams. Responsibilities Data Strategy and Development: Lead the overall strategy for the product domain including working with business, technical and analytical partners across the Enterprise to identify data needs associated with prioritized opportunities. Provide work direction within and outside of immediate business unit to ensure alignment with overall strategy. Data Strategy Execution: Partner with Technology’s Data Architecture team on overall design of data integration, aggregation, and storage ensuring safeguarding of sensitive data. Map out all data sources that exist today within the domain with owners/stakeholders defined. Work with external data partners to source and integrate relevant external data and develop and execute a multi-year roadmap for the data domain prioritized to business needs. Data Management and Governance: Partner with business unit data governance program to build and maintain a data catalog of data elements captured, including meta data information, and log data quality issues. Control and monitor access to data elements by data analysts, data scientists, and other end users. Leverage tools to document data access and usage on platform. Monitor data quality and report exceptions within framework established by Enterprise Data Governance for the analytical domain. Additionally, serve as data owner for any data and metrics generated by analytics teams that are associated with the domain (e.g. derived data assets). As such, through the creation and maintenance of the data catalog, surface and resolve with analytic and technology teams when there are derived data assets that are potentially in conflict or overlapping. Organizational Support and Change: Support teams across the business segment to become more data-centric and drive adoption of the use of new data domains. Engage data analysts, data scientists, BI reporting and others across the enterprise in the correct use and understanding of key data elements, which may include leading training sessions when new data is available, providing communications when data issues are identified, etc. Drive analytics strategy for Wealth Management solutions, including leading a team responsible for WMS cross-organizational business reporting and analytics and providing thought leadership in deploying proactive business analytics including trends around big data and analytics to help drive growth. Participate in cross organizational efforts related to data governance and management - Provide effective leadership to direct reports that incorporate performance management practices, such as individual performance plans, periodic reviews and feedback sessions, coaching, and development. Required Qualifications Bachelor's Degree 10+ years of experience in Financial Services industry with demonstrated experience preferably in areas of product management / data management and analytics. Strong knowledge of the wealth management and banking businesses, including knowledge of investment products and services. Ability to influence across organization; including executive and senior leaders across business, analytic, technology and staff groups. Ability to take complicated topics and translate into ease of doing business terms that business leaders can understand to make decisions. Deep knowledge and experience working with data and technology (e.g. data architecture, data/analytic tools, etc.) Strong strategic, analytical, judgment and problem-solving skills to analyze data, develop compelling solutions and/or recommendations. Proven people leadership experience; preferably 3-5 years Preferred Qualifications Master's Degree Demonstrated understanding of key data constraints and requirements (legal, regulatory, technical, etc.) that apply within wealth management and/or specific business segments. Knowledge of business drivers, metrics, and data for associated Company segment. Demonstrated experience as a business owner of technology implementations.
Title: VP Product Data Management & Analytics at Ameriprise Financial

Job_Description: We are looking for a VP of Product to lead our world-class product organization. You will continually invent, define, and build on the Company product portfolio. In this role, you will be a part of Company’s Executive Team as you work together to push forward the strategic vision of the company and create alignment across the organization. You will determine priorities, develop product roadmaps, and carry plans forward to implementation. You’ll own product definition, creation, implementation, and improvement end-to-end. You will lead the Product, Design and Data Science teams across our San Francisco and Waterloo office locations. RESPONSIBILITIES As a member of the of the Executive team you will be responsible for influencing strategy and goals, and for setting the product direction for the company Hire, manage and develop a team of great Product Managers, Designer, and Data Scientists. Own the overall Product Roadmap: strategy, goals, priorities, execution, process, organization and delivery Implement rigorous product management processes to enable both quantitative goal setting and measurement, and qualitative design research and testing Be the face of the product organization internally to cross-functional stakeholders, and externally to partners and customers Contribute to high-level conversations with our engineering organizations to develop long-term technology and data strategies Develop a customer-centric product culture by leading consistent participation in conversations with end-customers and partners REQUIREMENTS 10+ years of experience in product management, with at least 5 years of people management experience Track record of developing and mentoring leaders within an organization Experience managing design teams and data science teams Ad Tech, Marketing Tech and/or WiFi is a must have Experience in retail a huge plus Exceptional communication skills: in both one-on-one or small group settings, and in large cross-functional forums Track record of developing extremely focused, customer-centric product strategies Experience working with data privacy initiatives Experience working with and enabling external partnerships OUR VALUES Be Committed: Work hard, Own the problem, Learn Create Trust: Do what you say, Create trust with our Clients and Colleagues Be Bold: Experiment, Speak up, Hope is not a plan Deliver High Performance: Prepare, Commit, (over) Deliver
Title: VP of Product at Zenreach

Job_Description: The SVP, Impact, Data & Tech provides thought leadership, vision and oversight for Microsoft agency reporting, analytics, data and tech; is responsible for overseeing all cross media and digital measurement, reporting and analysis, as well as leading development of new analytical tools, data sets and approaches; an expert today with an eye on evolving our analytics for the future. As a leader within the Microsoft account, this role is a crucial collaborative partner to our strategy, audience science, ad operations, media and digital channel disciplines, sharing learnings that are useful and actionable. The position is the central point for integrating campaign and marketing performance reporting, analysis and optimization as well as for designing and developing new tools and automation across all Microsoft Lines of Business. Our ideal candidate will have a background in advertising reporting and analytics, knowledge of People Based Marketing, brand research (e.g. KMB), and measurement across personalization & segmentation, all broadcast and digital media, database and web analytics, as well as A/B and multivariate testing methods. In addition, the ideal candidate will have experience working closely with ad operations teams, a strong quantitative background with hands on experience in dashboard design, developing new tools and approaches, analytical programming and tech, data science, advanced analytics and modeling, etc. with working knowledge of new data set identification and onboarding. This person should also possess the expertise required to lead and continue building an innovative team, as well as the confidence to work with our internal executive team and senior Microsoft clients. Responsibilities Own the Microsoft-wide measurement vision and roadmap, oversee analytics and reporting teams to ensure metrics are captured and tracked, and applied to the decision-making process Introduce new data analysis techniques and tools that will provide a holistic and contextualized understanding of performance and optimization opportunities across the business Build relationships with senior Microsoft data and analytics and line of business client leads; Align with Microsoft consumer research, analytics and IDEAs groups to leverage and integrate their data and insights Recruit and develop talent, build processes to effectively create and deliver data and analytics insights and products Drive the efforts to improve our measurement capabilities, such as enhancing methodology and establishing process on in-channel and cross-channel incrementality, effectiveness and efficiency Direct Tech & Data team to build required tools, connectors, dashboards and integrations: Lead the team in evolving and designing new, innovative measurement tools and tech from concept to delivery / global roll out and adoption by MSFT Impact (analytics) teams Find opportunities to create and automate repeatable analyses or build self-service tools for business users Provide leadership and advice on KPIs to keep up with changing client objectives, new technologies and platforms to ensure the right metrics and measures are being used to drive business decisions Serve as a technical data lead providing subject matter expertise and guidance, being capable of owning complex data processes and rolling out new technologies where appropriate Draw on experience to evolve with major shifts in data types and availability driven by privacy regulations, changes in user IDs and types (cookie-based, people-based), etc. Anticipate MSFT needs for new data types, sources, and integrations; engage data providers when needed Make recommendations and build use cases on new data sources by addressing the biggest gaps in our data in relation to MSFT KPIs Integrate multiple data types / sources based on needs and use cases Oversee data access, management and maintenance Be mindful of privacy and security: ensure that data handling meets legal and ethical standards to protect the agency, Microsoft and customers and their data Collaborate with analytics leads across all Company sharing best practices, use cases, member development technicques, partner/vendor POVs, etc. Qualifications Minimum 10 years of experience in data and analytics, with extensive experience in building and leading analytics teams, developing analytics talent, and managing agile workflows Knowledge of databases with some hands on experience / technical skills, including writing SQL queries, Python, R, or SAS Familiar with AdTech toolsets and platforms, skilled in manipulating data sets and creating visualizations on key platforms, experience in designing and building/evolving dashboards in tools such as Power BI Experience with data sourcing, evaluation, onboarding and integration Sufficient understanding of data mining, statistical methods and technical capabilities to be able to guide the team methodologically, direct tool design and construction Knowledge of advanced analytics solutions, test design, modeling applications and methodologies including but not limited to MMM, MTA, LAL, predictive, etc. Understanding of media and digital reporting and analytics, familiarity with data sets, tools and vendors including but not limited to, DCM, IAS, DMPs, Nielsen DAR and other media performance, viewability/valid/on target and audience reporting platforms and tools Very strong interpersonal skills, can collaborate across many functions and build bridges of trust and mutual respect Analytics experience within integrated or digital communications or media agency preferred Global experience a plus
Title: SVP Impact Data & Tech at Carat

Job_Description: Position Overview: Company Commerce is looking for a VP, Data Management & Analytics to unite and lead the Company’s data-related functions.  You will work with all key business units, including the senior leadership team, to set, evangelize and execute on the overall data vision for the company, while striving to create value for Company.  You will manage a data management and analytics team to ensure they are serving the needs of the business, our clients and creating value.  The right person will be an influential voice across the entire organization and will ensure data is represented and accountable across all levels and functions by building a center of excellence that creates an enterprise wide insights capability.  This person will focus on providing value from day #1 and will support our B2B Company Commerce loyalty business and our D2C ShopSmarter.com and FreeShipping.com business lines. The position reports directly to the SVP, Marketing and is expected to have a high impact on the organization.   What You’ll Do: Develop and lead a data management and analytics team and ensure alignment across both functions Create data management and analytics strategy and roadmap establishment in support of the business vision for our loyalty and D2C business lines Identify & articulate a roadmap for headcount and tools/tech (CDP, user analytics, visualization software, etc) development.  This includes budget ownership Review current data integrity activities and ensure best practices are followed so that analytic functions can be trusted and implemented Create effective dashboards, KPI reporting, insight development and data visualization across all business functions Staff around key business lines to ensure business leaders are supported Work closely with our head of loyalty strategy to determine how this team can provide value and deepen our ties with our clients Develop and execute on a plan to activate our first party data to power our Marketing efforts Develop and execute on a plan to bring predictive analytics and early indicator reporting You will be the main point of contact for MarTech and client integrations Look for every available option to augment our data with new data from our clients, 3rd parties, vendors and key accounts Ensure analytics and statistical best practices are consistently applied across our clients, customers and marketing efforts Promote an overall strategy of data literacy by mentoring, ensuring representation in key decision-making processes and ensuring we are using industry standards Identify where techniques like artificial intelligence, machine learning, data science and modern statistical analysis can provide value for Company Review current activities and implement new processes around data governance and data integrity best practices Experience and Skill Sets: Senior-level leadership over data and analytics teams for ten or more years and experience with modern team design and tool implementation who has produced tangible results Experience in a digital/online environment and a background in retail and/or D2C environment and understanding of how to use data to improve business outcomes and user experiences Must be comfortable managing a large existing team and ensuring optimal utilization of resources Outstanding writing skills and verbal communication as well as excellent time management skills Previous experience in loyalty and/or a subscription business model is a plus Tools you will work with:  AWS, MixPanel, Tealium (CDP), Tableau, Google Marketing Platform, Adaptive, Snowflake, Matillion, Redshift, S3
Title: VP Data Management & Analytics at Clarus Commerce

Job_Description: The Vice President of Data Operations (the “VP”) will be a senior member of the management team responsible for managing the processes and people that enable the data collection, processing, modeling and analysis required to create customer and business value from the Company’s data assets. Reporting to the SVP of Strategy & Business Intelligence, the VP will work closely with Program Management to coordinate on project execution, and collaborate on requirements with other senior stakeholders including Product, Revenue Operations, Content, Engineering, Advertising, and Business Development. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated, passionate leader from a data-driven environment that operates equally as effectively in both independent and team collaboration settings. He/she should have a strong business acumen, solid technology experience, and familiarity with the broadcast industry in addition to possessing excellent data analytics skills. The VP will be responsible for the implementation and ongoing management of innovative, enterprise-wide analytics capabilities necessary to power the company’s BI initiatives, and to generate meaningful, actionable insights into user and advertiser behavior across the entire Company network. Will be responsible for streamlining and automating the collection, management, and analysis of consumer, product, social, market, competitive, and ad data to lead to high impact business insights that help move our business into the future. The ideal candidate has the ability to see solutions in sprawling data sets, the business acumen to convert insights into strategic opportunities for our company, and the communication skills to communicate key insights to an executive audience. It is a unique opportunity to help build out industry-leading digital analytics and insights capabilities for the nation’s largest broadcast company. Responsibilities Day-to-day management of the Analytics team and associated functions Ensure accuracy of analytics and insights produced Develop, maintain, and improve holistic data sets from internal and external sources to generate proper data visualization reports and dashboards to support executive management decision making as well as tactical next steps and KPIs Work with the SVP of Strategy & BI to help drive the definition of data and research needs to empower executive decision making and establish best practices for technologies, tools, and processes Work with Product leadership to support Analytics and Insights needs for all new product development, from initial market and product research to post-launch performance reporting Establish the short and long term requirements to support Company’s advanced Data capabilities, including budget, resource and system requirements, and management strategies required to lead and execute on key projects Grow our capabilities to support a full-featured analytics, insights, and data science platform Partner with the Engineering team to maintain a scale-able and efficient analytics infrastructure Identify new data sources and strategy for obtaining and managing audience data Oversee market research and customer satisfaction survey initiatives Prepare research, communication materials and presentations for the senior leadership team across Company Digital and the Company Media Group team Minimum Qualifications 10+ years in data and analytics, market research, insights creation, and strategy development Knowledge or prior experience in media/entertainment or with a direct to consumer streaming service a plus Demonstrable thought leadership in the field(s) of Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics Strong cultural and team leadership skills Creative problem-solver with ability to look beyond existing business and technology limitations to identify the “next thing” In depth understanding of all stages of customer acquisition, conversion, and lifetime value Proven success in the execution/project management of large-scale data mining and insights projects from inception through completion Expertise in qualitative and quantitative research methodologies, and experience developing market-based research solutions System knowledge and experienceData modeling and analysis Market research and survey tools Syndicated research services (comScore, Nielsen) Business Intelligence reporting tools (e.g. Data Studio, Power BI, Looker, Tableau) Digital Marketing tools for instrumentation and analytics analysis, such as Segment, Google Analytics, and Datorama Data Integration tools such as SQL, Spark, Scala, Python, Data Bricks, Airflow, R, Machine Learning a plus
